alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 2:53PM MST until December 26 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...South Laramie Range including the Interstate 80 Summit between Laramie and Cheyenne, especially between Mile Markers 315 and 330. * WHEN...11 PM MST this evening until 11 PM MST Tuesday. The worst conditions are expected overnight into Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and near-zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A High Wind Warning is also in effect for the same time period.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
